intro: Eriocaulon subtile, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a small aquatic or semi-aquatic plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and compact, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds and streams. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, with three stamens and a single pistil. Eriocaulon subtile plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic invertebrates.
